snippet: The ousted prime minister voiced confidence in her innocence in connection with a plan to prop up rice prices, which her opponents called a waste of money.
abstract: Thailand's former Prime Min Yingluck Shinawatra pleads not guilty to charges of criminal negligence over scheme to prop up rice prices.

byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Bangkok.

lead_paragraph: The ousted prime minister voiced confidence in her innocence in connection with a plan to prop up rice prices, which her opponents called a waste of money.

headline.main: Yingluck Shinawatra Pleads Not Guilty to Negligence Over Thai Rice Subsidy
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; Thailand: Ex-Premier’s Trial Starts

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
